intro: Schismus barbatus, commonly known as the hairy grass or desert grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and fibrous roots. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Schismus barbatus is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Its presence often indicates well-drained soils and can be found in deserts, coastal dunes, and disturbed areas.
